activationMode.description:
The activation mode of the tabs. Can be `manual` or `automatic`
- `manual`: Tabs are activated when clicked or press `enter` key.
- `automatic`: Tabs are activated when receiving focus

asChild.description: Use the provided child element as the default rendered element, combining their props and behavior.

defaultValue.description:
The initial value of the tabs when it is first rendered.
Use when you do not need to control the state of the tabs.

deselectable.description: Whether the active tab can be deselected when clicking on it.

id.description: The unique identifier of the machine.

ids.type:
Partial<{
  root: string
  trigger: string
  list: string
  content: string
  indicator: string
}>
ids.description: The ids of the elements in the tabs. Useful for composition.

loopFocus.description: Whether the keyboard navigation will loop from last tab to first, and vice versa.

navigate.description:
Function to navigate to the selected tab when clicking on it.
Useful if tab triggers are anchor elements.

onFocusChange.description: Callback to be called when the focused tab changes

onValueChange.description: Callback to be called when the selected/active tab changes

orientation.description:
The orientation of the tabs. Can be `horizontal` or `vertical`
- `horizontal`: only left and right arrow key navigation will work.
- `vertical`: only up and down arrow key navigation will work.

translations.description: Specifies the localized strings that identifies the accessibility elements and their states

asChild.description: Use the provided child element as the default rendered element, combining their props and behavior.
